text: William Thomas "Billy" Mainwaring (born Gwilym Thomas Mainwaring; 24 January 1941 – 3 April 2019) was a Welsh rugby union player. He played as a second row. He played for Wales in 1967–68. He appeared for his country six times. He played for amateur teams Taibach, Aberavon, Bridgend and the Barbarians. He was born in Port Talbot. He worked as a steelworker. Mainwaring died after a long illness on 3 April 2019, at the age of 78. ==References== ==Other websites== * Billy Mainwaring at ESPN Scrum Category:1941 births Category:2019 deaths Category:People from Port Talbot Category:Welsh rugby union players
title: Billy Mainwaring
